baseProperties.description: These are properties that are automatically attached to every action that is sent to the downstream tools. They must be provided as base properties by your instrumentation when you initialize the metrics client

appVersion.description: The current application version. Value should be grabbed from your app's package.json file

product.description: Identifier to reference the product that is sending the action to the downstream tools. Visit the Product Breakdown wiki to learn more

businessUnit.description: Identifier to reference the business unit in the downstream tools. Visit the Product Breakdown wiki to learn more

component.description: Unique identifier to reference the application that is sending the action to the downstream tools

environmentName.description: Identifier to reference the environment where the action was sent from

userId.description: Identifier to reference the user that executed the action

userGroup.description: Identifier to reference the group a user belongs to

enumDescriptions.automation: These users fall within the automation group (i.e. dd synthetics, load tests, automation tests)
enumDescriptions.internal: These users are Cventers. Whenever a user is identify, the email, company name, account name and initial refferer are properties that are used to determine if this is an internal user
enumDescriptions.external: These users are considered actual customers. If an internal user didn't follow the rules when creating accounts they will be placed in the external group
enumDescriptions.unknown: This user is an annonymous user. Once they login or signup, they will be placed under one of the other groups

utmCampaign.description: The campaign name the user belongs to. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_campaign param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmSource.description: The source of the traffic, that is, from which site, advertiser, or publication the user came from. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_source param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmMedium.description: Defines which medium the visitor used to find our website. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_medium param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmTerm.description: Used to manually identify paid keywords targeted by your campaign. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_term param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmContent.description: Used to identify the exact element on an ad or promotion that was clicked. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_content param is in the current url as part of the query string

persona.description: Identifier to represent the user's characteristics

enumDescriptions.attendee: These users are users that attend an event either in person or virtually
enumDescriptions.exhibitorAdmin: These users are users that set up and manage an exhibitor for an event
enumDescriptions.planner: These users are users that plan and coordinate all aspects of an event or webinar
enumDescriptions.speaker: These users are users that present a topic or a talk during an event or webinar
enumDescriptions.visitor: These users are annonymous users that visit any of our web sites (i.e cvent.com, knowledge center, etc)

isCVIIUser.description: Identifier to reference if an action was executed by a user logging in from cvii or a user loggin from within the application

trackingPlanName.description: Identifier to reference the name of the tracking plan this action is associated with

reservedProperties.description: These are properties that are set explicitly by the metrics client. They are used to give more context to your actions and for analytics purposes

pathname.description: Represents a location in a hierarchical structure. It is a string constructed from a list of path segments, each of which is prefixed by a / character

duration.description: For measure actions, this property is set automatically by the metric's client and indicates how long it took to record the action in miliseconds

result.description: Identifier set automatically by the metric's client and used to reference the result of an action in the downstream tools

enumDescriptions.success: The page_load/action was tracked as success after receiving a response from the BE
enumDescriptions.error: The page_load/action ended in an error after receiving a response from the BE
enumDescriptions.expected_error: The action was tracked explicitly by the instrumentation as an expected error. Validation errors fall within this category
enumDescriptions.incomplete_measure: The action was never tracked by the instrumentation. The metric client tracked it as incomplete on a route change

type.description: Identifier to tell if the action was tracked

enumDescriptions.not_tracked: page_load/action was missed by instrumentation, so page rendered with no error but duration is off
enumDescriptions.unhandled_error: The ErrorBoundary caught an error, and a full error screen was shown
enumDescriptions.handled_error: The page had an error loading, but it is handled within the component
enumDescriptions.abandoned: page_load was never tracked by the instrumentation. The metric client tracked it as abandoned on a route change

events.description: this action measures the time taken in navigations to any page, as measured from the browser
events.name: planner events hub ui page_load

payload.title: How to Start a Hotel Business: The 8-Step Guide | Cvent Blog

product.description: Identifier to reference the product that is sending the action to the downstream tools. Visit the Product Breakdown wiki to learn more

businessUnit.description: Identifier to reference the business unit in the downstream tools. Visit the Product Breakdown wiki to learn more

component.description: Unique identifier to reference the application that is sending the action to the downstream tools

environmentName.description: Identifier to reference the environment where the action was sent from

userId.description: Identifier to reference the user that executed the action

userGroup.description: Identifier to reference the group a user belongs to

enumDescriptions.automation: These users fall within the automation group (i.e. dd synthetics, load tests, automation tests)
enumDescriptions.internal: These users are Cventers. Whenever a user is identify, the email, company name, account name and initial refferer are properties that are used to determine if this is an internal user
enumDescriptions.external: These users are considered actual customers. If an internal user didn't follow the rules when creating accounts they will be placed in the external group
enumDescriptions.unknown: This user is an annonymous user. Once they login or signup, they will be placed under one of the other groups

utmCampaign.description: The campaign name the user belongs to. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_campaign param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmSource.description: The source of the traffic, that is, from which site, advertiser, or publication the user came from. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_source param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmMedium.description: Defines which medium the visitor used to find our website. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_medium param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmTerm.description: Used to manually identify paid keywords targeted by your campaign. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_term param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmContent.description: Used to identify the exact element on an ad or promotion that was clicked. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_content param is in the current url as part of the query string

persona.description: Identifier to represent the user's characteristics

enumDescriptions.attendee: These users are users that attend an event either in person or virtually
enumDescriptions.exhibitorAdmin: These users are users that set up and manage an exhibitor for an event
enumDescriptions.planner: These users are users that plan and coordinate all aspects of an event or webinar
enumDescriptions.speaker: These users are users that present a topic or a talk during an event or webinar
enumDescriptions.visitor: These users are annonymous users that visit any of our web sites (i.e cvent.com, knowledge center, etc)

isCVIIUser.description: Identifier to reference if an action was executed by a user logging in from cvii or a user loggin from within the application

trackingPlanName.description: Identifier to reference the name of the tracking plan this action is associated with

events.description: this action tracks the users who saves the image in order to use as logo in events+
events.trigger: this action is triggered when user clicks on check mark button in edit state of website image section in branding section

utmTerm.description: Used to manually identify paid keywords targeted by your campaign. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_term param is in the current url as part of the query string

utmContent.description: Used to identify the exact element on an ad or promotion that was clicked. This property is automatically captured by the framework and set as a base property as long as the utm_content param is in the current url as part of the query string

persona.description: Identifier to represent the user's characteristics

enumDescriptions.attendee: These users are users that attend an event either in person or virtually
enumDescriptions.exhibitorAdmin: These users are users that set up and manage an exhibitor for an event
enumDescriptions.planner: These users are users that plan and coordinate all aspects of an event or webinar
enumDescriptions.speaker: These users are users that present a topic or a talk during an event or webinar
enumDescriptions.visitor: These users are annonymous users that visit any of our web sites (i.e cvent.com, knowledge center, etc)

events.name: planner events hub ui upcoming events switch toggled

events.trigger: this action is triggered when user clicks on switch button on 'upcoming events' feature card in Events+ Hub feature page

upcomingEventsStatus.description: Shows the status of upcoming events feature whether it is on or off

enumDescriptions.automation: These users fall within the automation group (i.e. dd synthetics, load tests, automation tests)

enumDescriptions.external: These users are considered actual customers. If an internal user didn't follow the rules when creating accounts they will be placed in the external group
enumDescriptions.unknown: This user is an annonymous user. Once they login or signup, they will be placed under one of the other groups

customUserTraits.description: These are user properties that identify your users with information that are specific to your product (ie. nextWebinarDate, billingCycle, etc). These properties are stored and encrypted in the device's local storage so that they can be carried as properties of every action tracked

cdpUserTraits.description: These are user properties used during the identification process. Usually right after users sign up or every time they login. These properties are stored and encrypted in the rl_trait cookie so that they can be shared cross domain. These properties are also carried as properties of every action tracked which can be used in the downstream tools to segment user data

userId.description: The unique id that identifies the user

email.description: The user email used during signup or account setup

company.description: The company the user works for

accountName.description: The user account number. This is the accountNumber in CVII

persona.description: Identifier to represent the user's characteristics

license.description: The type of license assigned to the user (ie. Self Service, Enterprise, etc)

subscription.description: The subscription the user holds for your product (ie. Webinar Free, Webinar Pro250, etc)
